title: blockheads
content:
I just started a little dingbat idea (based on a simple 4x4 grid) and would be glad about some comments, whether it is worth to elaborate...

thanks in advance

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [blockheads.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200447/http:/typophile.com/files/blockheads.gif) | 19.19 KB |
| [block-icons-rounded.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200447/http:/typophile.com/files/block-icons-rounded.gif) | 27.67 KB |
author: fontsoldat

comments.content:
Hey, how come I missed this? Did everybody else?  
Because it deserves attention.

hhp

That's one thing I noted about Typophile more than any other forums on type I've checked out... the posts and replies come fast and furious. If there are no comments or replies on a new topic within 24 hours, it could get buried three pages deep on the "Recent Posts" page.

As for Mr. Nicolai's dingbats, they are imaginative, and dare I say, notanic! The rounded forms are almost Aztec/Inca in imagery.

But I fear our notice of them now is just "too little, too late."
